intro: Palafoxia riograndensis, commonly known as the Rio Grande palafoxia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It produces showy, pink to reddish-purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its drought tolerance.
